title: [$250] Ensure newly added report actions allow threads being created on them

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

comments.body: Current assignee @trjExpensify is eligible for the Bug assigner, not assigning anyone new.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Current assignee @thesahindia is eligible for the External assigner, not assigning anyone new.
Upwork job price has been updated to $250
Switching out the `Bug` label now this has an Upwork job.

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Ensure newly added report actions allow threads being created on them
### What is the root cause of that problem?
We only allow `Reply in thread` for some special actions

https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/8c909d1a0b1c16d3130cc6d220f656f2ba9b2bdd/src/pages/home/report/ContextMenu/ContextMenuActions.js#L133
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
In `CONST.ts` we have `ACTIONS.TYPE` which is a list of report action types. Because almost all actions can have `reply in thread` option, firstly we can decide which actions don't have `reply in thread` option and create a util function like `shouldReplyInThread` that will return false if the action types are in the list action that doesn't have `Reply in Thread` option, otherwise return `true`.

When we have a new action, if this action can have `Reply in Thread` option, no need to change anything. If not we only need to add this to `shouldReplyInThread`.

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
I won't be able to take this. Asking another C+ for help.

📣 @s77rt 🎉 An offer has been automatically sent to your Upwork account for the Contributor role 🎉 Thanks for contributing to the Expensify app!

[Offer link](https://www.upwork.com/nx/wm/offer/27807672)
[Upwork job](https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~014617a7e47bd69ebb)
Please accept the offer and leave a comment on the Github issue letting us know when we can expect a PR to be ready for review 🧑‍💻
Keep in mind: [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) | [Contributing](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) 📖

@s77rt To do that we can create a new const like NOT_ALLOWED_THREAD that is a list action that we don't allow thread option. And in `shouldReplyInThread` we can check if the actionName isn't in this list and isn't the thread first chat.
In the further when a new action is added, we only need to add this to `NOT_ALLOWED_THREAD` const if it doesn't has thread option, otherwise do nothing. We don't need to update `shouldReplyInThread` any more.

body:
👋 Coming from [here](url), we'd like someone to look into an automated solution to avoid running into this again. We've added a bunch of report actions in recent months, and we'll be continuing to do that as we bring more functionality over into NewDot. As we've built these report actions we've intermittently shown the `reply in thread` button in the comment action menu on them. That created a situation where some report actions allowed threads while others didn't, leading to an inconsistent and confusing experience with no rhyme and reason to it. @tgolen outlined some options [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/28934#issuecomment-1797035494) on how we can better catch that in development going forward to make sure we uphold this consistency for threads. That's a good place to start and we'd like someone to explore the options further to put this safeguard in place. Thanks!
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
